Class GameObjectFactory

java.lang.Object
com.tron_master.tron.model.object.GameObjectFactory
public class GameObjectFactory extends Object
Factory class for creating GameObject instances (currently Player types). Encapsulates the object creation logic for different game object types. Follows the Factory Pattern to decouple object instantiation from client code. Designed to be extensible for future GameObject subclasses.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes

    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameObjectFactory.GameObjectType
    GameObject type enumeration for type-safe object creation.

  • Method Details

    • createGameObject

      public static GameObject createGameObject(GameObjectFactory.GameObjectType type, int x, int y, int velocityX, int velocityY, ColorValue color, String mode)
      Create a concrete GameObject based on type.
      Parameters:
      type - desired object type
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      velocityX - initial velocity X
      velocityY - initial velocity Y
      color - color for player objects
      mode - game mode string
      Returns:
      new game object instance

    • createHumanPlayer

      public static Player createHumanPlayer(int x, int y, int velocityX, int velocityY, ColorValue color, String mode)
      Convenience method to create a human object.
      Parameters:
      x - Initial x coordinate
      y - Initial y coordinate
      velocityX - Initial velocity in x direction
      velocityY - Initial velocity in y direction
      color - Player color
      mode - Game mode
      Returns:
      A new PlayerHuman instance

      velocityY - Initial velocity in y direction
      color - Player color
      mode - Game mode
      Returns:

      Creates a static wall with specified dimensions and color.
      Parameters:
      x - Top-left x coordinate
      y - Top-left y coordinate
      width - Wall width
      height - Wall height
      color - Wall color
      Returns:
      A new Wall instance

    • createLinkedPortalPair

      public static Portal[] createLinkedPortalPair(int entranceX, int entranceY, int exitX, int exitY, int width, int height)
      Creates a linked portal pair (entrance linked to exit).
      Parameters:
      entranceX - Top-left x coordinate of entrance
      entranceY - Top-left y coordinate of entrance
      exitX - Top-left x coordinate of exit
      exitY - Top-left y coordinate of exit
      width - Portal width (same for both)
      height - Portal height (same for both)
      Returns:
      Array of [entrance, exit] Portal instances, already linked
